Plot T-Statistic Distributions with Observed Values and Annotations

Source: R/plot_T_distribution.R
plot_T_distribution.Rd

This function visualizes empirical null distributions of T-statistics for selected features (e.g., genes) using either permutation- or bootstrap-based inference. It overlays observed T-statistics as dashed lines, and when bootstrapping is used, adds 95 inference, empirical p-values are shown in the facet titles.

Usage

plot_T_distribution(
  x,
  features = NULL,
  statistic = c("T_null", "T_boot"),
  title = NULL,
  point_size = 0.5
)

Arguments

x

A named list output from perm_interaction_effect() or similar, containing null distributions and summary statistics. Must include a summary_stats data frame and either T_perm or T_boot depending on the statistic type.

features

Character vector of feature names to plot. If NULL, the first 9 features (columns) from the selected null matrix are used.

statistic

Character string indicating which null distribution to plot. Must be either "T_perm" (for permutation) or "T_boot" (for bootstrap).

title

Optional title for the entire plot.

point_size

Numeric value to control relative font or point size (not actively used in this version).

Value

A ggplot object consisting of histograms of test statistics per feature, with vertical lines showing observed values and either p-values (for permutations) or confidence intervals (for bootstraps).

Details

The function automatically creates facet plots for each feature selected. If statistic = "T_perm", the observed test statistic is plotted with a dashed blue line, and the empirical p-value is included in the facet label. If statistic = "T_boot", the observed value is plotted with a dashed blue line and the 95

If the required null distribution is missing from the input object, the function will throw an informative error.
